p: In the DPPH test, the most active sample was the essential oil from P. domestica leaves collected in July (P5) with an IC 50 value of 73.78 μg/mL. The other IC 50 values were in the range of 80.05–105.76 μg/mL. The different antioxidant activity demonstrated in these tests by the essential oils may be related to the different stereochemistry and training mechanism of the ABTS and DPPH radical. For this reason, after reaction with antioxidant compounds, these radicals gave a different response [ 20].
